Instruction: Cook egg noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente, about 5 minutes. Drain the noodles in a colander.

Grease an 8-inch square glass baking dish suitable for the microwave. Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl, then add the cooked noodles, white sugar, chopped apples, sour cream, cottage cheese, cinnamon, salt, and raisins. Combine well and pour the mixture into the dish.
Microwave on medium high (70% power) for 7 minutes.

Combine brown sugar and chopped walnuts in a bowl, and mix in the butter until crumbly. Sprinkle the topping over the pudding. Return the pudding to the microwave and cook on medium high (70% power) until the center is firm, for 7 to 9 minutes.
